articles.description: While some of the most common symptoms of the novel coronavirus are fever, fatigue and dry cough, research has claimed sore eyes as a classic ocular symptom of COVID-19 too. Although the deadly virus originally affects the lungs and is a respiratory illness, …
articles.content: According to the World Health Organization, conjunctivitis was added to the list of less common symptoms of COVID-19. However, a recent study published in the BMJ Open Ophthalmology reported sore eye… [+435 chars]

articles.title: Vaccine manufacturing is lumpy, supply not as good as hoped, UK says - StreetInsider.com
Pharmacy suggests getting on any COVID-19 waiting list you can amid State's next allocation | KVUE - KVUE
articles.description: Tarrytown Pharmacy has about 40,000 people on its waitlist, but didn't get chosen by the State for week six allocation of the COVID-19 vaccine. MORE: kvue.co...

articles.author: Express News Service
articles.title: New research has found depression could reduce Covid-19 vaccine efficacy - The Indian Express
articles.description: Simple interventions, however, may maximise the vaccine’s initial effectiveness, the Association for Psychological Science has said in a new report, which recommends exercising and getting a good night’s sleep in the 24 hours before vaccination.
articles.content: Health behaviours and depression, stress, or loneliness have been known to alter the bodys ability to develop an immune response to vaccines. This could potentially include the new Covid-19 vaccines,… [+2743 chars]
